description:
Go for Happy Hour .  Great atmosphere!  Phenomenal Service!
Get a glass of wine a before a performance at The Curran.
Glass of red goes great with their potatas bravas.
author: John W.

description:
I stopped into the European last week for a quick happy hour drink and meeting as I'd hat it bookmarked for a while and wanted to see what it was all about. It's located inside the Warwick hotel and easy to find. 

I ordered a martini which was really well done. Tough to mess up but, the bartender was super friendly. The happy hour food however...that's another story. The olives were incredibly salty (and that's tough to do even for me), the mixed nut medley was pretty meh and the patatas bravas was just ok. I'm not sure if they're going for a Spanish theme here because the bar doesn't give that vibe but, the menu sure does. 

Anyway, overall it's an ok experience but not something I'd send people to given the amount of high caliber food/eats in the surrounding area.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
I came here yesterday around 330 and it was really busy. Luckily after 10min I got a seat. The bartenders were attentive and friendly and one of them made my drink, Dangerous Bangkok, with a lot of precision and detail. The flavors were there, but I didn't love it.

After visiting yelp, I was confident that the European had happy hour, but when asking about it, I was told there was no happy hour.

Also, this bar brings more of a stuffy crowd with suits and business meetings. I assume it's because it's connected to a hotel, but I wish I knew before I planned to come here to meet up with a friend.
author: Gita r.

description:
We came here, with only a day's notice, with a group of forty (yes, 40!) people for a pre-theater Sunday Happy Hour. Chef Miguel, Bar Man Eric, the wait staff, and the food all made me look like a genius to my group.

We descended on the place in waves, and built of to a large group with discriminating taste for exceptionally good food and well fashioned drinks. We were all delighted with the variety and quality of tapas and the innovative, as well as classic, drinks they offer here at the European. 
There was just no stumping Eric, he's a master behind the bar.

The tapas are rich, delicious, and varied as they come from kitchen of Bota Tapas Restaurant, right there in the hotel. I did quite a bit of table hopping among my happy guests and tried a little bit of many dishes. Patatas Bravas, Garlic Shrimp, Chicken Fingers (who knew chickens had fingers!?), Brussels Sprouts, on and on. Every choice was a hit. The Charcuterie plate, meat and cheese, was one of my favorites ( I hovered at THAT table for a while! ) Oh... and the Lamb Chop Lollipops ...OMG tender, moist, and flavorful!

Great food, fine wine, expertly mixed drinks... and a quiet TV behind the bar so some people can keep one eye on the game in progress!

The European has a separate room, right there next to the bar area, separated by a heavy drapery. It has a warm feel to it, with tables, sitting areas, coffee table, and an roomy mingling zone right there in the middle.
It's a nice discreet area to sit when it's just you two. But for us it was like a cocktail party room all our own. Classy. 
Lots of people, or just a couple looking for a place to have a pre-show (or even post-show) drink and a nosh, this place is perfect. The Curran Theater, and The Geary Theater, are both right across the street. Once you realize how great the food is, ask for a table right there at Bota Tapas and Paella Bar, just across the lobby.... but more on Bota next time.
author: James G.

description: It was fine. I wanted to like it for the European-themed decor, but it's also really dark and the bathrooms are really far away from the bar. The happy hour prices are decent (great for beer and wine), but the cocktails are subpar.
author: Alice Z.

description: This spot has a frustrating tension in it with super energized bartender. And he seems to be working almost frantic at times. While the other guys are relaxed and doing great. I sat there wanting a cocktail for some time it was an old fashioned that looked amazing only issue it took a really long time to create one of them. I didnt have that long I just had 15 minutes to spare so I drove in and wanted a cocktail. Wrong spot for that when I actually got to me he said what would you like I stated. A Manhattan please no cherry. And he gave me the sweetest old fashioned with an Amaro and sweet vermouth. I paid and left but not a good spot for good cocktails. I heard it was. Maybe once before but not now. Or get another bartender that holds standards.
author: Eric G.

description: Recommend sitting by the bar and watch him work. It's a show with many drinks. Cocktail Pear fizz is great if you are looking for sth sweet.
author: Jingchao G.

description: This place is connected to the Warwick hotel. Stopped here for a drink before heading to the airport and they happened to have happy hour specials from 12-7pm on a Sunday! The Honeysuckle was on HH special and it was really good.
author: Eva R.

description: The waiter did not bother clearing the table before seating us; never asked if we would like water, menus or drinks - "yeah, I came to a restaurant for dinner to stair at my date the whole time and not eat".  We eventually were able to order drinks and an appetizer but we were never asked if we would like to order for dinner - after 20 minutes no drinks, apps or water we were getting up to leave and I received my drink.  When we did get our drinks and apps we were never asked to order for dinner or checked on.  I waived the waiter down for the check and we left.  It seemed like he was out of it or did not care we were there - there were 3 or 4 tables with customers at them in the restaurant with the same befuddled looks on their faces.  I would not give it a second shot or recommend this place.
author: Leahcim S.

description:
I really want to love the bar but fell short. One drink and left. 

I felt it wasn't welcoming. Bartender wasn't on the friendly side but not mean. Felt as if they just want your one drink, pay and leave. I guess standard hotel bar? Been to a few cocktail bars that day and its my least favorite. The drinks was so so, nothing special. I got the European, assuming its their signature but taste average and wasn't crafted to my opinion. I will not be returning since there are so many other cocktail bars in the area.

Also they changed a lot of the menu so you might not get what you come for.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Stopped by pre-dinner last Friday.

Cool space. Poorly made, unbalanced Old-Fashioned. Poor service by the female serving the room, before it was crowded.

Would not return.
author: Ethan R.

description: Had two of the best cocktails we've had since being in San Fran. We got he 490 and the edelberry and honey one (I forget the name) but they were so good. Terrance was a drink magician.
author: Lori S.

description:
In an area with not many great happy hours, I was excited to learn of The European's lengthy one. Upon entering, I was intrigued by the fun decor and cool bar, and there's ample tables and room, another plus.

My friend and I ordered the cheese plate, and we found it to be a nice assortment with fun accompaniments. I think there is room to have a little more creativity with the wine list, but perhaps they are instead to focus on their cocktail program, and I haven't tried any of those yet.

I'm not sure if I came on an off night, but I did seem to find the service a lot bit slow and inattentive. It wasn't terrible by any means, but i think with some extra care in this area, The European could move from solid to great.
author: Holly L.

description: Amazing old fashion performance by newcomer bartender Matthew.   Best OF. I've had in SF.
author: Manena H.

description: Nice happy hour menu- although when we arrived (at 4:45 pm), the kitchen was closed (happy hour goes until 8), so that was disappointing. Their wines were good (had the petite Sirha & cab). Good place to come for a conversation (music is very faint).
author: Rob M.

description: Bartenders are on point. Mixing up fantastic cocktail and service. Great ambiance and vibes. A must
author: Matthew H.

description: Drinks came one at a time over 30 minuets. There were less than 15 people in the bar. I get these are craft cocktails, but all drinks should arrive at the table at the same time. To top it off, while they were good, they were not spectacular!
author: Heather P.

description: This is a very lovely and welcoming oasis. Excellent happy hour and true value for money. Relatively near Union square but away from the tourist bustle. I would definitely recommend this place and will be back.  The lounge at the back is comfortable and intimate. The music is also alternative yet relaxing. Come on in!
author: Roberta R.

description:
Really poor service.  Drinks all came out at different times, the waitress didn't put our order in correctly then went on break.  The bartender then retook our order.  When we requested our drink he then made a rude comment about not having cheap brandy?, 

Even though the forgot to bill us for several drinks, we overpaid. Unfortunate...
author: Yvonne R.

description:
Classy joint with great drinks and long hours to be happy.  Lamb lollipop was the bomb at $12.
Great place to hang and talk.  Good service
author: David H.

description:
Soooo happy we stopped in here after having a horrible experience just a few streets over! This is my new go-to place! I am new in the neighborhood and trying out the local happy hours! I will definitely be back!! We were immediately greeted by a very friendly bartender, Daytona! The happy hour wine featured was McManis, which is an incredible happy hour wine; a generous pour for $6!!! We ordered a few bar bites: olives and the bar nuts. Both were delicious. The atmosphere was congenial and it was also a great place to people watch on the corner of Geary and Taylor.

I will definitely become a regular here!
author: Sheila K.

description: I guess I tried to come here a year ago, but it was closed for a private party. Made it this time. Wanted the Bangkok dangerous, but they were out of one ingredient. Got the return to mexico instead and it was pretty good. Also had the secreto iberico, which was good too. Will come back again to get that Bangkok drink.
author: Lisa T.

description: Strong drinks! We popped in on a Saturday night and surprisingly this place was super quiet. They had drink and appetizer specials and the drinks were strong. Server/bartender was eh-seemed bored out of his mind-however-he did at the end recommend some pretty great places to eat!
author: Virginia T.

description: Amazing place for nice drinks, actual conversations and amazing attentive service. True & rare spot in SF!
author: Ivana M.

description: Side of the Warwick Hotel on Geary Street. Across the Clift. Did some shopping and decided to try something new, yet close by. The European was awesome! Looks fancy and classy but casual feeling. Great drinkmakers! Yummy bar snacks of meat plate, brussel sprouts and calamari. Lively yet not overly crowded on a Friday. Going to the restroom takes a few seconds to find but not a bad trail after a glass of Pinot. Bar closes around 11pm ish if not busy. It's a cool place to hang out with gfs and good convo.
author: Vee V.

description: Came here on a Sunday. Pretty empty but the drinks were flowing. This place was listed as one of the top cocktail bars in SF so I had to wet my whistle. Def worth a try.
author: Gordon L.

description:
Josh is a true gentleman and a scholar of Bar arts! His cocktails have tons of complexity and offer a layered dimension of flavor! But he's also kind and gracious and a joy to talk with if you're in the beer and shot sort of mood. He just started not long ago at this spot, and it's become clearly a much better bar than the riff raff crew who used to haunt the place with negativity. 

This place serves food from the new Bota restaurant which replaced the somewhat stale Aveline cuisine. Lotta really good Tapas. I especially love the Smoked Oysters!!! This menu is perfect for coming in with friends and ordering a nice variety of dishes.

The Happy Hour here is also a major plus as they have $7 cocktails and $4 beers! Plus the happiness lasts until 8pm!! This place will keep you smiling!
author: Zachary T.

description: Eric and Brendan are the best!!! The shiznit!!! Their knowledge & effort into their cocktails make it worth a visit.
author: Michelle C.

description: Decent cocktails in a nice little bar tucked off the street. It's not huge but the ambiance and lighting are good. Go for happy hour - they have decent drink selections and a few bites to share.
author: David Z.

description: Horrible service! We just went in at 2pm. On Yelp it says they open at 12. According to Yelp they've been open for 2 hours. We go in asked the front desk if they were open they said they yes. They said they had an issue with a bartender I'm assuming he/she didn't show up. They said there was another bartender and would give us whatever drinks we asked for. Bartender came to me and told me, "I won't be ready for a while." Ummmm.. you guys have been open for 2 hours and you're still not ready to serve our drinks? And I told him the front desk said he would serve us whatever we wanted and he told me, "Well I'm not." He was a bartender with glasses and bald. Didn't see/ask for his name because I was very mad!!! If you see him get out of there. That bartender is very rude. Ugly attitude. Front desk and bartenders should get on the same page.
author: Erika R.

description:
Guys, I've found my new favorite hotel bar!

The European fuses the old world charm with the new without being super trendy. I like that! But don't worry, it won't replace my beloved Burritt Room as my go to drinking spot, which coincidentally is only an 8 min walk from the European. However, you'll see me checking in here more often (oh hey stalkers) since they have a bargain of a HH. From open til 7pm, you can get $6 wine, $6 cocktails, $4 pomme frites and $4 braised pork sliders. If you're feeling classy and sh*t, get the melt in your mouth $9 steak bites. 

I LOVED that they have the Aperol spritz on the HH menu since I usually like to start off with a low alcohol drink these days. (shuddup Peter L!) Aperol, prosecco and club soda is a combination that's pretty much a winner with any of the ladies. Not to mention, it brings me back to the time I gallivanted in Italy for two full weeks drinking nothing but this sparkly referesher. The European and Nouveau are also very good choices. And if you don't like your drink, don't fear. The European is the kind of place where you can be completely satisfied with your selection and if not, as what happened with me, Jake went the extra mile to make it right despite the very packed bar. It's that kind of hospitality that wins me over and makes me a regular. 

Highly recommended, but of course, only as a first stop before Burritt Room  ;)
author: Janice C.

description: I had an excellent Old Fashioned at the bar, and a great conversation with the bartender. He's a young man and we got to discussing bitters, he was making his first batch of celery bitters and let me give it a try. I'd definitely go back if I'm in the Tenderloin.
author: Steven C.

description:
An underrated and often overlooked spot for happy hour, The European is a great spot to catch up with folks after work over a couple glasses of wine and little bites. 

Happy hour till 7pm Monday-Friday with $6 bubbly, wines, and a handful of cocktails. The red wine is pretty legit for happy hour and it's a decent pour. It also pairs well with some steak bites ($9 during happy hour). The steak is tender and a wonderful bite-sized take on the classic steak and potatoes combination. 

I'm sure there were greater ambitions for The European and Aveline but selfishly I'm glad it's evolved to where it is now. It's an eclectic space that is refined yet comfortable and service is attentive and friendly. If you're looking for a quieter spot to grab a drink and relax near Union Square, The European is definitely worth considering.
author: Jon L.

description:
Great things about The European:

- They have mezcal.
- Open as early as 4pm.
- Food
- Friendly 
- Can conversate without shouting. 
- Chill vibe

 This is the kind of place that I would like to come back. I hope you give this cocktail bar a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Great drinks, great service. Spacious venue.

Happy hour from 4-7p with nice variety of $6 specialty cocktails (wine, beer options as well).

At $6 they might as well be free!

If you like gin, I highly recommend the European Sling and the Zesper.

If you stop in, hopefully you're lucky enough to get Mike -- awesome bartender and he takes great photos of you (if you ask nicely). :)

Thanks for the great find, Yelp!
author: Pamela K.

description: Three stars because it was convenient and attached to our hotel. One star for the service, because the bartenders all seemed so angry. That was kind of weird. I ordered a Sidecar and the bartender balked and said he couldn't make it. Strange for a bar. The other bartender was a bit squirrely and hostile. Oh well, I ordered something different. Overall, the space was beautiful, but the service was off. Maybe another night, I suppose.
author: Ann G.

description: This bar is under our hotel and the drinks were amazing! The 490 miles is my new favorite cocktail! Adam, our server, was wonderful.
author: Laura D.

description:
These guys were on point, and the vibe was perfect. 
If you're looking for a chill place with a nice, slick atmosphere, the European will not disappoint.
author: Charles S.

description: Drinks are ok and not so special. The beautiful looking seating area was so small and the place gets so loud at times. Some music would have been nice. U have to take a hike for restroom located down stairs. The food is a bomb though. Next time will go to their tapas place next door.
author: The S.

description: We have visited this location multiple times now, patiently waiting for the drink menu to be updated and thus far it hasn't disappointed. Our regular bartender was not there the last time we visited, and we were not too please with the service of the bartender that night, nonetheless, sometimes this can be overlooked with amazing drinks. But rest assure we soon provide feedback, on customer service, if we encounter this again.
author: Cristina P.

description:
Some friends were at happy hour last Friday, May 5th, so I decided to meet them up. Showed up around 6pm. They were seated in a couple of seats at the side of the bar. Luckily it was empty in the small front lounge area, so I was able to grab a small table and seat.

Happy hour: Monday-Friday, 3pm-7pm
*Steak bites ($11): crisp potatoes, bordelaise, creme fraiche
*Pommes frites ($4)
*Popcorn ($4)
*Charcuterie plate ($11): four chef's selected meats, crackers, fixin's

HH seems like a fun way to try a bunch of appetizers. I wasn't very hungry, so I didn't try anything, but everyone seemed to enjoy the food. They also ordered a dish from the regular menu: Mushroom fritters - lemon aioli, fried mushrooms ($11).

Drinks:
*Gran negroni ($13): gin, gran classico, campari vermouth
*The Brooklyn ($12): rye, china china, maraschino, dry vermouth

I got the Brooklyn which I enjoyed. I prefer dry vermouth over sweet vermouth, so this has become one of my favorite drinks. I had a sip of the negroni which was pretty tasty as well. Since it was negroni week, they they were donating $1 for every negroni to the Shanti project.

Great place to have a drink before having dinner next door at Aveline!
author: Elena N.

description:
Although it's located a bit too close to the TL, the European is a charming cocktail bar that I hope stays a hidden gem! The ambiance is upscale but not snotty. They have bar seating, sofas, and tables... plenty of space for you and your friends!

HAPPY HOUR is during Monday-Friday from 3pm-7pm
- Glass of Cava ($5)
- Sparkling Cocktails ($5): nouveau, flume, odori, and golden alpes were all delicious. Hey, they were only $5 each, so I had to try them all...
- Bubbly Cocktails ($6)
- Happy Hour Beer ($2): TWO DOLLARS! Where can you find $2 beer anywhere!? Granted, it's not fancy schmancy beer... it was still drinkable!
- Food items range from $4-$11.
- Cheese or Charcuterie Plate ($11): very creative plating and delicious!

4 cocktails, 2 beers, and 1 cheese plate came out to be around $40 with tip. Happy hours here definitely won't break your bank! ;)

I'm usually a beer kind of gal, but I may become a cocktail kind of gal if I frequent The European often!
author: Christine S.

description:
We stumbled upon this place while walking  around Union Station.  It has a nice bar and we went into the back.

It is a non-traditional place to eat, we sat at some very comfortable sofas.

We arrived at happy hour and immediately ordered cheese plate and the house red.  The cheese plate was excellent, with good mix of cheeses, fruit, and jam.  The house wine was quite nice.

We were in a group and ordered variety of food.  Four of us ordered the burger, two medium and two medium rare. They all came cooked the same way (clearly med. rare) but we all loved them. Great brioche bread, tasty caramelized onions, and a really good burger.  I would have preferred if it was not slathered in mayo (despite not on description) but I just scraped it off and enjoyed it.

We also had the fries which were really good.  The calamari  was nice also.

It is part of a hotel, but definitely worth a visit.
author: Edward S.

description: Very interesting drinks.. mines was served in a green bell pepper.
author: Jan H.

description: Where to begin?! After stopping at about 5 different bars We came across the European inside the Warwick ! The bar is cozy and comfortable yet elegant. Presentation wise the bar is definitely high end and rated a 10 in my book. More importantly the customer service that Jase provided was absolutely superb ! He was funny, engaging and charming. He was extremely knowledgeable and helped with questions about drinks, food and night life in the city. The experience was extremely fun, and happy hour is from 11am - 8 pm !!!!!!!! You can't beat that!
author: Alex L.

description: Stayed a couple nights at The Warwick and big bonus to have this bar down below.  We ordered some tasty bar food (Brussels sprouts, pork and shrimp plates) plus you can order the restaurant menu (BOTA) in the bar.  Not your typical hotel bar - definitely great service, food, drinks and atmosphere!
author: David M.

description:
Excellent happy hour! Cocktails for $8ish and wine for $5ish until 7pm. 

Ben ordered a Negroni, and his first comment was "this tastes just like the one I had at that Italian restaurant in Spain", so I guess the "European" name fits. 

There is also a limited menu of bar snacks for about $10, we had a substantial chese plate.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Just down the street from Union Square this spot is located right on the corner of Geary & Taylor, right next to the Warwick Hotel. The bar is actually connected to the hotel next door--I believe they can charge your drinks to your room but don't quote me on that. 

I was looking for an upscale place that had a happy hour (M-F 4p-7p) and this place delivered. I showed up right as happy hour was starting and there were relatively few people there. The bartender was friendly and attentive. The only thing that I was a little disappointed by was the limited happy hour food menu, but only because I was craving something but didn't know what that was--Hot wings? French fries? I'm not sure but they definitely don't have the typical bar fare.

I wouldn't recommend this place if you're bringing a large group but it's great for meeting with a friend for post-work drinks. It's a bit on the pricey side but with the classiness and being in San Francisco, I kind of expect that.
author: Sharon G.

description:
A nice hotel bar to bring visitors, or pregame, or a few drinks before going to dinner. It is modern, trendy, and inviting from the bustle outside that is Union Square bordering the TL. For us locals who can go anytime, their HH ends at 7pm. Make HH as the drink prices are on the high side, higher than at most drinking spots.

Making this place the night's destination is reaching a bit though. The venue is big but the layout feels cramped because there aren't that many seats out at the bar. Just bar stools and a couple of small tables by the door. Toward the back is a lounge with chairs and tables.

The cocktails and bar foods (charcuterie plate was pretty good) make up for it; drinks are on the strong side too.
author: Peter L.

description:
I went to the European with a few co workers after work for drinks on a Friday. The bar had been recommended as a great cocktail lounge by one of our customers. It was pretty busy when we arrived around 8pm, but we still received excellent service from the bartenders. 
As someone with little knowledge of cocktails, I was taken back by the extensive list of options. The bartender, Josh, was so nice and helpful. He took the time to ask me questions about my likes and dislikes and came up with a few great options for me. 
For my first drink, I wanted to try something fun. I went with the Californication. It was so delicious and refreshing and I loved that it came in the bell pepper. 
After I finished my first drink, I was feeling a bit more adventurous, so he made me a special concoction not on the menu. It was a smoked rosemary cocktail. The rosemary was "smoked" right there in from of me, which I thought was pretty cool since I had never seen that done before. Yet another excellent choice!
My co workers also tried a variety of the cocktails both on and off menu, and not a single negative reaction. Everything was so great here, and the service was top notch. 
I would highly recommend this lounge to anyone looking for some nice cocktails, a cute comfortable bar/lounge to hang out in or book for a party.
author: Megan W.

description:
Very nice, more upscale bar. Delicious cocktails and great bartenders. 

Love the vibe and decor of this place. Next time I want to stay near the FiDi to meet up for drinks with a date, this will be my spot.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
I thought I already wrote one for this spot, but it looks like I haven't. I'm shocked because I really meant to some months ago when I hosted a party for a friend in the back lounge-y area. It was actually a baby shower, but she wanted something not very baby and not very shower. This place delivered!  It was swanky yet comfortable and the food, drinks and staff were all great!  There's a big velvet curtain you can pull to section the area off but we ended up not pulling it over that far. Nice to have the option. 

Quick call out on the food...we ordered several items to have lots of choices for our semi-big group. Everything had a gourmet spin to it and the flavors were great. I can't believe I haven't been back yet. Soon!
author: Christy H.

description:
The European is a cool lounge located adjacent to the Warwick Hotel on Geary & Taylor in the "Tendergroin" in SF.  It is very European and is befitting of a high-end chain like the Warwick.

We ordered a couple of signature Europeans (don't have the ingredients), and a Love Letter (vodka, lemon, hibiscus, ginger & seltzer) at $12/each.  Unfortunately, both drinks were too sweet for all our tastes.  We switched to real men drinks afterwards:  Tequila rocks w/ a squeeze of lime; vodka tonic; and rum & coke:  3 Stars for the cocktails.

The ambiance is very nice and there are several tables to sit at, or push together for a large party.  A couple of downsides are if you want to eat, be prepared to drop $3/each for Fanny Bay Oysters, or $18 for a burger w/ fries.  In addition, if you want to use the restroom, it is down the elevator and around the corner:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the service was very good from our waiter.  He was attentive and very polite:  4 Stars.

3.5 Stars overall.  The European is a cool place to have drinks after dinner and before a club.  But avoid the froo froo drinks because they are way too sweet for a real man - LOL!!!
author: Joe P.

description: Beautiful room, tasty cocktails, nice service. Happy hour is fun; the place was a little quiet at first but it warmed up quickly. And the lamb lollipops.... don't think, just order!
author: S R.

description:
When you put a Beretta alum behind the bar and a lush in front of him, you got real troubles. The lush will drink every deliciously buzztastic drink presented to her and will end up faceplanting into a plate of katsu curry down the block in the seedy loin then having it to uber it back home while her car sits at the parking lot at work.

Hmmm, I wonder who this lush is? Not I.

OTHER NOTES:
*Located inside The Warwick Hotel, The European is the adjacent bar to The Aveline (Top Chef's Casey Thompson's new restaurant). Both are grand opening tomorrow. They will be providing drinks for the restaurant.
*Attended a private event yesterday and sampled an array of cocktails. The savory Sauternes celery cocktail was interestingly enough my favorite. I pounded two of those. =X
*Cocktails are $8-$12. Here's a link to the cocktails and bar bites menu: http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/files/2014/06/TheEuropeanMenu.pdf
*Really friendly and helpful staff (Thank you to Betsy for the invite.)
*Old world Euro décor with plushy couches in back for lounging with hip hop music playing. Yay for Tupac!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Went there for a work happy hour. The specialty cocktails were good, but pricey for the location and the separation of the back room to bar hurts the ambiance in my opinion. More music, maybe candles/decor could improve the mood this place. Also, PS, don't try to service charge a group serving themselves for just cocktails.
author: Molly O.

description: My husband and I were looking for a spot in Union Square where we could have a few drinks and not have to yell to hear each other.  This place was a great choice.  Bartenders were friendly and conversational and the drinks were nice and strong.  Ambiance was sophisticated yet casual.
author: Fay A.

description: One of my Favs. Gr8 Bar staff. Gr8 Happy Hour
author: Peter L.

description: Good place for Happy Hour had a few drinks and a cheese plate as I figured out what I wanted to eat for dinner
author: Joe O.

description: Rude bartender! He claims he didn't have a rum for a specialty cocktail....NEWSFLASH you're a bar! If you are worth your suspenders you'll "create"! Sad! With that attitude and lack of creativity it's no wonder you have very little patrons!!
author: Ray R.

description: Just stopped in for some cocktails, excellent service, drinks were on point; mid-day stop at around 2:30pm so not a lot of traffic for a Thursday. I would stop by again for sure!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Nothing short of awesome! Josh the bartender was fantastic from beginning to end! Try the Brussels
 sprouts!
author: Boxxxman J.

description: Great happy hour from 4-7pm. Pretty much all the drinks including wine, champagne, and cocktails are $6 and High Life "champagne beer" is only $3. My favorite cocktail is "San Francisco Sour - bourbon. lemon, lime, pinot noir" and as for food, I ordered braised pork sliders $4/each = BOMB. If you're hungry I would get 2-3. Great bar, great food, and great bartenders.
author: Jenn L.

description: Went for happy hour here, it was really good.  Excellent value for what was offered.  Hefty pours on the wine, excellent lamb pops and charcuterie plate.  The staff was friendly as well.
author: Kristine K.

description:
My friend took me to this place for happy hour and said there was $2 beer and $5 cocktails. I didn't believe her. 

I was wrong. There was actually $2 beer, and yes it's not the best beer, but it's $2! The cocktails on the happy hour was pretty good. They had about for different house cocktails. I recommend the plume. I thought it was the best out of the four. 

The European is a beautiful looking bar. The decor has all sorts of interesting things to look at. In addition to traditional bar seating there are sofas and tables located next to the bar where you can kick back and relax after a long work week.

This is a great place to bring a date or have a casual drink with some friends. It's not to crowded and the staff is friendly and service is quick. It's not too loud in there so you can actually have conversations. The prices are amazing during happy hour. Oh yeah, the bathrooms are an elevator ride down.

Cheers!
author: Allen C.

description: The patatas bravas had the proper amount of spice and flavor. The bartender made me an off menu cocktail with coconut and pure magic.  They have a chill ambiance and fantastic location.  Great place for a night out downtown.
author: Brian K.

description: Very good. Probably the best restaurant that I went to on my trip.  I had the burger. They make it in a way that tastes rare but isn't chewy and easy to eat. They did serve two meals on one plate leading to some confusion with my party, but the meal was not compromised. The seating arrangement is strange, but if you don't mind putting the plate on your lap.
author: Tristin S.

description: Whoever is making the cocktail menu at this place is pretty on point. They've got some really interesting, unique drinks that I'd never think to order. Plus a spicy cocktail that nearly singed my eyebrows off (in a good way). But I think the true test of a good bar is how well they can make an old fashioned. This place passes with flying colors.
author: Brodie G.

description:
Shhh! Don't tell anyone about the happy hour at the European! This is an undiscovered gem and by that I mean not overcrowded but offers great happy hour deals and delicious food and drinks!

The European is located a couple blocks west of Union Square and is attached to a hotel. They offer happy hour from 5 until 7 pm with 6$ cocktails that are amazing! I recommend Le Nouveau! The cheese plate also looked amazing, I will try it next time I stop by. 

The atmosphere is fancy and chic, makes you feel like you're in a lounge. Dark wood, comfortable seating, and marble floors.  The waiters are good, not too pushy,  letting you have space to enjoy.

Overall,  good quality of food and drinks with very affordable prices! If you're looking for a happy hour in the FiDi, then I'd definitely recommend the European.
author: Aletta B.

description: Amazing burgers and drinks! I love the atmosphere here- it's a great place for me to unwind after work and enjoy some Happy Hour wine and cocktails + amazing pork slider for only $4. This is my new favorite spot, and the staff is nothing short of incredible; fast service and all very personable.
author: sharon t.

description: Fantastic food, drink and service.  Had the house red and calamari.  Great after work spot.
author: Deb N.

description:
Charming, quaint atmosphere that caters to a more upscale clientele so not the ideal spot to be rowdy with your friends. However, if you are in search of a place to unwind over well made craft cocktails then The European might be the place for you. 

There is enough drink variety to suit whatever you fancy that night but I don't know if they have a wide beer/wine section. I also can't comment on the food but based just off the drinks I think they are definitely worth a try down the road.

Overall Thoughts

You had me at craft cocktails!
author: Eddie W.

description: A small space sitting immediately next to a hotel, the European plays a lot of good music from the past that have not gone out of style. The food is interesting. The buns on the sliders are a tad too thick, but the meat itself is tasty. The half size charcuterie is only available as all cheese or all meat, so a full plate is required if both meat and cheese are desired.  The bread that comes with the charcuterie is quite delicious and different, and the selection of meats and cheese are also good quality. The crab cakes are a bit on the salty side, but are crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. This isn't the best for beer, but the wine selection is available by the glass, half bottle or full bottle. Keep in mind that the amount of wine poured if ordered by the glass is a bit less than other venues.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Stopped here for happy hour while visiting SF on Monday January 2nd. Our bartender was down-to-earth and funny. He made us some absolutely delicious cocktails (the scarlet letter). We ordered some bites that were also all very tasty. We will be back again next time we visit the area.
author: Grace B.

description: Great scotch list. Generous pours. Near the theaters. Friendly service. Nice wine list.
author: M N.

description: Well what can I say about this place.. it has a ying yang aspect to it. On one hand it is a beautiful bar great to be inside for more mellow atmosphere. Drinks look decent, they are creative for sure maybe trying a bit hard. Good whiskey selection as well.  Now the yang service was terrible. WORST OF ANY BAR.  Both bartenders bitched and moaned the entire time the complained about minor things that would come up and did not seem to happy about making anyone's drink that night. Almost as if how dare we bother these two knuckle heads with a drink order.  Also get rid of the gimmick drinks I don't need to sip out of a red pepper all night. So basically I will never go back there so many better choices of bars with better drinks and no attitude. And I should use Jekyll and Hyde example, sorry ying and yang . Thanks for listening
author: Javier H.

description:
The European is the cutest hotel bar ever, located in the Warwick Hotel lobby across from Aveline (by Chef Thompson from Top Chef). The space is decorated with comfy modern european sofas in the back and a spacious bar up front. The moment we stepped in, a waiter greeted us - the service was impeccable - prompt friendly and warm - from start to finish! 

* BUTTERED AND POPPED ($7) - 2.5 STARS:
mushroom popcorn, sumac butter, manchego
Sounded amazing but didn't taste very fresh. The generous portions of butter and cheese helped alot. Not my favorite but I have to admit, I polished this off despite the criticism.

* BIEGNETS (?) - 3 STARS:
The savory beignets were denser than I would have liked them to be, served with a small swipe of creamy tomato sauce. I couldn't help but compare them to Rich Table's superior porcini donuts because they had a similar dense texture. These were pretty tasty and a fun bougie nibble at night, but not the best I've had. 

* BATTER (?) - 4 STARS:
dark chocolate, cashew, hazelnut, dust... and we will even let you lick the spoon.
This is so decadent, even I had a hard time finishing this. Delicious and a fun dessert to share.

Their wine by the glass selection is fairly limited but good. I enjoyed the Obsidian ($16/glass) just as much as I did last time I was there. Note: They switch to a late night menu at around 10pm. 

I can't wait to come back and try their cocktails!
author: Jess C.

description:
This bar used to be a modern meets 1920's bar with classic European cocktails but unfortunately it has turned into the tenderloins most horrendous nightmare. I used to be a regular here and Shirley the bar manager was amazing. She is no longer there and the people who run it now are not up to par. 

The health department may need to take a closer look at what has happened here. I don't know if it is even safe to eat or drink here anymore. There was literally a hair in my drink the last time I went.
 
The worst part was the abhorrent women who was behind the bar. I believe she may have been the manager, which makes this even worse. I saw her dipping her fingers in some sort of food behind the bar and licking her fingers, she then proceeded to wipe and pick her nose. She did not wash her hands. She served someone a drink at the bar and was touching her hair and put it behind her ears, she then touched the food again and once again licked it off her fingers. It was absolutely appalling. I asked her for her name and she said it was Sarah. 

I don't mean to come across rude because I loved this place and it is so sad to see it go down hill so fast. I am a saddened disappointed customer. Definitely not worth your time anymore.
author: Natalie F.

description: Lots of things happening at the Warwick Hotel. On one side you have Aveline the new resto by Casey THompson. On the other you have the European, opening on the same day. As we were eating at the other we came through for a drink after dinner. The long Bar up front and lounge seating and tables in the back. It's dimly lit and has a older aesthetic. My only issue with the place are the hours. Even on a Friday night they do last call around midnight so we didnt get to spend as much time as we wanted. However it's worth a return run to get a full spread of their food and drink
author: Kim N.

description: I went here with 3 girlfriends before a show at the Currant. It's right across the street! Mac and cheese is the best ever! The burgers are great. Speakeasy style atmosphere, love the wallpaper and decor. Drinks are yummy!
author: Terese O.

description:
Happy hour is highly recommended. Decent house wine selection, with great bar bites options. Steak bites were spot on, fries were slightly above average. Ask for the dessert menu, brownie batter was heavenly!!! 

I think what wins me over about this place is the cute decor, attentive service, and good vibes for a Friday happy hour with friends :)
author: Catherine U.

description: We couldn't have started the night better than this: fabulous happy hour cocktails that regularly rotate and great deals on the nibbles. See (or taste) for yourselves. http://nomnomventures.com/2016/01/24/a-for-aperitif/
author: Joy L.

description: The food is amazing, not one thing I didn't love. The first couple of times here were wonderful experiences. The only thing this time was that one of the bartenders (tall Caucasian man) was kind of snippy with me. Not sure if he made my drink, but it was incredibly spicy that I could barely drink it. When I mentioned it to him about it he coldly said that's just the way the drink is. and he ended up just throwing soda water into it making it even nastier. His customer service was just not well managed.
author: Anna W.

description:
Excellent service that is both knowledgable and friendly.

We just had a drink (Can can an Irish whiskey cocktail) and some wine with their amazing cheese plate. The best thing about that cheese plate was the seaweed pumpkin crackers with the perfectly paired sides with the cheeses, a honeycombe, some milk jam, and even a walnut pesto.

Great pairings and I'm sure the rest of the menu doesn't fail to meet out expectations. This is a cozy place that shan't be missed!
author: Vinh N.

description: Nice looking bar. Happy hour cocktails were pretty decent. Service that night was a bit slow as only one bartender was on duty. Skip the food and go elsewhere to eat.
author: HiCam H.

description:
Heeelllooo $2 Happy Hour Beers!! Goodbye Liver! Quite the gem to escape the hustle and bustle of Union Square! 

This bar has a suave and a sophisticated 30's flair that is casual and non-intimidating. No need to bust out in your favorite fedora or flapper dress here! The moment you walk in, you're greeted by a long stretch of bar with loads of seating and in the back, there are a couple of lounge seats where you can get a little intimate with your drinks - or human friends. 

The Happy Hour menu offers a good selection of alcoholic necessities - for me, that's beer and french fries. The beer, being two bucks and all, was just a can of 4% light stuff however they also offer various wines and cocktails I have yet to try. I DID have the Amaro shot to make things interesting and WHOA. It was like downing a sugary, soap-smelling syrup that burned my insides (totally awesome). I was pretty much singing along to all their Frankie Valli songs and other random 60's music in between. 

If you feel like being EXTRA fancy without burning a hole through your wallet, they even have an $11 cheese plate! I HAVE to come back again! I MUST come back again!
author: Krissy L.

description: Inattentive service. Unremarkable food. Calamari super breaded, sauce boring.  Sliders missing seasoning. Nice atmosphere. Would go back only if not hungry, not worried about long periods w/o a drink, and not expecting any polite service from the bartender.
author: Ernst L.

description:
Great craft cocktails made and served without attitude. Bartenders seem to really like what they do.
Exceptional bar menu. Price point isn't exactly cheap but, the prices are by no means outrageous.
I've paid a lot more for a lot less in this town.
Highly recommend this place.
author: Flix N.

description:
4.5 stars. Fantastic cocktails. I would highly recommend the ritz 75 ( much better version to french 75) and royal highball (a bor sour taste but perfectly refreshing in the balance of other flavors, no longer on the menu unfortunately).

The best dishes were chicken skin and wagyu tatare. Avoid the mustard green tempura or liver mouse.

This place starts to gain momentum around 9pm or 10pm. Unless you have a big party, it may be hard to feel the energy at this place, especially early in the evening.  I would recommend going later than earlier.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
For a bar and restaurant to execute this well (if not as fast as one might hope) on a soft open is a great sign.

Starting with the Parisienne gnocchi covered in Camembert the only complaint might be for a funkier cheese but the texture of the gnocchi was great. Portion size was good (in a practical sense) but seemed small for the price.

Quality prawns came with an assortment of accompaniments including an interesting yuzu mignonette and a horseradish salt that could have been more punchy.

The pork jowl bacon was like a marriage of bacon, lardo, and prosciutto: hot and savory waiting to be heaped with bright ricotta on delicious pita. You can almost hear your heart begging you to look away.

The burger's bun could be firmer (perhaps simply more toasted) but the Vegemite butter and vidalia onions kept me me coming back for bites even after I finished the great fries, dipping them in the Hollandaise-topped egg presented in its shell.

Adam, Sarah, James, and the rest of the bar crew serve an impressive lineup of new cocktails and quality versions of standbys. There are a number of lower-alcohol aperitif cocktails that all escape the too-sweet and uninteresting fate to which most lighter options fall. The menu is helpfully divided by style and presentation, moving on from the lighter options to rocks, ups, downs, and spiritous options. Among them is the Can Can, my favorite of the night, with an initial dramatic note of lavender that soon settles into a dangerously drinkable combination of whiskey, maple, and bitters. Whatever you may think lies outside your normal preferences I urge you to give these drinks a try. A drink with strawberry wasn't at all too sweet. A drink with vodka managed character. A drink made with Sauternes was unmistakably a cocktail without losing the character of the wine.  

I have no doubt my rating is destined to rise as the service is polished to match the excellent fare. Come now before you'll never get a seat.
author: Joshua P.

description: Great mixed cocktails from the bartender and it wasn't too overcrowded on a Saturday. You could come here, converse, drink, and not be overwhelmed with loud music or crowds. This is my type of bar.
author: Jason F.

description:
I have nothing to say about this place but great things. There are no 'buts' here. 

Classy, yet chill bar with plenty of space, comfy couches, tables and chairs, cool music and delicious finger food and drinks. 

They have a comprehensive list of craft cocktails to satisfy various tastes, some good wines, and simple food that is tasty and fresh...Oh that awesome feeling when you take the risk of going for the "gourmet french fries", and instead of being disappointed with the usual frozen stuff you are surprised with truly home made, finger licking fries! Even something as simple as popcorn was delicious here . 
The guys (and girl) behind the bar were also really cool and attentive. However, the best part of it all for us was having it right downstairs from our hotel room, so it was easy to stop by everyday after our SF adventures and have good bites, sips and vibes before venturing into the night...
But even if this is not your case, making a trip to The European will surely pay off...
author: Rocio P.

description:
I've lived in the area for nearly 2 years, walked past this amazing hole in the wall bar countless times over the last year and finally decided to come in with a girlfriend of mine after a productive work out session. 

First, the happy hour is AMAZING! Super reasonable prices for how good they are. $3 beers, $5 bubbly cocktails and $2.5 oysters. Everything is fresh, and the bartenders really know what they're doing. Ambiance is quiet, not one of those packed and hot happy hour bars you'll generally find all around the city. 

I'm not a regular, and come here at least 2-4 times a week to unwind with friends who live here or friends who are visiting. I would recommend this bar to EVERYONE.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Sandra's knowledge is awesome and we had a great time finishing off our night at the bar with her! Highly recommend!!
author: Jenn S.

description:
I am obsessed with the Violet Fizz. Granted, I can only  enjoy one (two is one too many) but I need that one Violet Fizz at least a few times a week! 

The staff is always welcoming, professional and proactive. I've sampled most of the cocktails and a few of the wines but as I've said, I adore the Violet Fizz.

Both the food and the drink menus are creative, playful and well executed.  I've also had every dish on the menu. The cheese plate is exquisite, one of my absolute favorites. I'm also partial to the beef tartar.  This is "bar food" at it's finest.

Sometimes I like to sit at the bar and chat with tourists, sometimes I like to sit in the back and have a quiet conversation but I always have a fabulous time.
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description: Food was good/ nothing to write home about... Service was slow and very awkward would go somewhere else
author: Shannon H.

description: I liked the decor, and also the drinks.  Good cocktails, lots of brown liquor.  There's a bar in the front and then tables/lounge seating in the back.  The seating wasn't the most comfortable or intimate but it was pretty roomy.
author: Vivian W.

description: Love this bar. It has a really chill ambiance, not what you'd expect from a hotel bar. The staff is really pleasant and, most importantly, they make some killer cocktails. Our bartender was Josh, and I just told him what kind of flavors I like and he directed me to some delicious menu items, and even customized some fantastic cocktails for me. Great date or casual hangout spot.
author: Elizabeth Y.

description: Came here for happy hour today and they said they weren't doing happy hour because there were business people in town. I said never mind and left and saw the happy hour sign hidden when I exited. I'm a local and was looking to check out a place that I was hesitant to visit because I thought it might be snobby, and I was right.
author: Spencer O.

description:
Smitten.  That pretty much sums up how I feel about The European.  The cocktails are a homerun and my personal favorite is the namesake cocktail, The European, a mix of Campari, fresh grapefruit, seltzer, & lemon!  I'm craving one just thinking of it!  But if Campari isn't your bag, then give any of the expertly crafted cocktails a try and you are sure to find one or five that keep you coming back for more -- The Love Letter, The Duke, & Grazzie Mullie, & Sauternes Punch are drinks that knock a delicious punch!  

The bar menu is top notch - it's playful and pairs perfectly with the gorgeous cocktails!  The brisket burger is slammn, the wagyu tartar is ridiculous, and the mushroom dusted popcorn is drool worthy.   Best bar food in the city.  Nuff said.

The setting is a perfect mix of your best friends living room & your favorite european lounge.  it's warm, friendly, buzzing, and has a legit playlist.  Mix all that with smart & friendly bar staff and you have your new home away from home!  See y'all there soon!
author: Dana B.

description:
While the food may be great and the cocktails are decent, their servers can't figure out how to run a credit card. They charged my card FIVE times for 3 different amounts triggering a fraud alert on my debit card. 

So if you want an experience that lingers with you long after your meal, come here and you too can spend an afternoon on the phone with your bank to clear up The European's mistake.
author: Tatyana K.

description: Came here on Monday before Christmas.  A nice relaxing oasis from the chaos of Union Square.  Good cocktails and friendly service.
author: Vivek V.

description: Good food with amazing sauces! Garlic butter with the fries are amazing, the dark sauce with the steak bites are delicious, and the sauces that Come in the burgers make the ordinary burger superb. The drinks are strong and unique. The menu is more interesting and better than the typical cocktails you get. I highly recommend the crabapple holiday drink.
author: Grace B.

description: Solid place to grab happy hour cocktails and snacks.  Good cocktails, good food, and good atmosphere.
author: Amjad S.

description: Great specialty cocktails, the bartender Mike is great. They have a good liquor selection. Had the steak bites, perfect snack to go with a cocktail.
author: Vincent A.

description: Great ambiance and happy hour specials like $6 house wines and special cocktails.  Lots of seats at the bar, as well as nice couch configurations in the back for small groups.  The burrata appetizer with grilled peaches is delicious.  Small complaint:  the cheese plate is tiny and not worth $11.
author: Sona P.

description: Great food (sliders!!!!) and drinks, love HH prices. When we went, it was no crowds on a Friday after work. Love it.
author: Susannah R.

description: Cozy feel. Recently renovated and a very handsome space. Great drinks. The royale was the best drink. Will return!
author: Food L.

description:
This review is for cocktails only:

The European is a nice place to sit and try some interesting craft cocktails.  We sat at the bar and our bartender was friendly, making conversation with us every once in a while.  Seems like most of the drinks aren't on the sweet side so it was perfect for our tastes.

The Duke - good, dry, all alcohol.
Cocktail de Triomphe - pretty balanced and the crushed pink peppercorns added an interesting element.
Casino Royale - sort of like a straightforward martini...and the pickled onion infused the drink as it sat, which I liked.

The bf also asked our bartender if she could make a Brooklyn.  They didn't have all the ingredients but she made a version of it and he was pretty happy with it.

Next time we plan to try some of the items on the bar menu.  We had just finished dinner at the adjoining Aveline so bar food right after was definitely not possible!
author: Elaine G.

description: Seems like if you are not sitting at the Bar, nobody cares for you. We were greeted by the bartender and informed that someone would be with us shortly. Unfortunately shortly means 20 min or more...we left the location after 20 min and won't return!
author: Heiko S.

description: Had some delightful happy hour drinks! We especially loved the Rosemary manchego popcorn and the shishito peppers
author: Sharon S.

description: I recently had drink here with the Director of Sales and Marketing of the Warwick hotel, and the signature cocktail is fantastic. I highly recommend The European for great drinks and a great atmosphere. You will also not meet more of a quality and personable person such as Steve Sajadi.
author: William M.

description: Came in to the European based on the Yelp reviews.  Gorgeous decor, would make a great date spot.  Really authentic and delicious drinks.  I am not sure that I've ever had a better Old Fashioned.  Wish I'd stopped at the drink though.  At the recommendation of my bartender, I ordered the Waygu beef and fried potatoes.  Didn't realize that the beef would be raw, but I was happy with it, since I am a fan of beef tartar.  The potatoes were sorta soggy and way too rich for my liking, especially paired with the beef.  I ended up getting food poisoning that night.  Not sure if it was a fluke - I would have thought that a place like the European would be up on their food standards.
author: Chris K.

description: My husband and I enjoyed our time at this little bar. Happy hour specials were excellent. If we hadn't had dinner reservations, we would have definitely taken advantage of the happy hour food options. Only knock is that wish the wall opening between the bar and hotel lobby was glass so that did not hear the patrons on that side and their children
author: Danielle K.

description:
Horrible experience! 3 bartenders, 1 GM, and 1 "apparent" owner...,= MORE horrible service!!!!  1 hour for 3 cocktails and NO OTHER customers at bar..,, do yourself a favor and DO not visit. IT will not be a happy hour....at all! 
Go across the street!
author: Lysa K.

description: Finally, three stops on Geary and finally found one worth stopping at. Staff were friendly, fun and engaging. Food was delicious and timely. Would stay longer but our quest is calling!
author: Henry S.

description: Heather is an amazing bartender! The fried mustard greens are a unique treat. Definitely will be back.
author: Jeremiah L.

description: Bar tender cool.  Very quiet.    Too quiet.  Great atmosphere if you do not want people around.  Give it time.
author: Anita L.

description:
I came to The European with a friend mid-week for a cocktail. It's somewhat of a bar within a bar. 

I only had one drink, the grapefruit happy hour cocktail that was a bit too tart for me, but the bartender was really pleasant and attentive. 

Also had the pommes frites which are tasty!
author: Kaego R.

description: Delicious, attached to the Warrick hotel,  this bar features unique cocktails. I had the Ruby Red ($13) with charbay ruby red vodka and the Love Letter ($11) vodka, lemon and ginger. The man tending the bar has mad mixing skills. Nice atmosphere, nice seating at bar and in back.
author: Sarah H.

description: I would give the bar 4 stars for the decor and atmosphere, the bartender was brand new, but was really nice and did his best to take care of the food and drinks for our large group during happy hour. The manager came by our table to welcome us which was a nice touch. The unfortunate part and the reason for the 2 star rating was our waiter, who seemed annoyed in general and was pretty rude to our group. He was largely MIA for more than an hour (which matters during HH when you want to take advantage of the specials) which is why the bartender was serving us directly (we were seated in the back), then showed up to 'apologize' for disappearing, but really to scold us for not following protocol in only ordering from him and also to criticize the new bartender for not following procedure (was he supposed to ignore hungry and thirsty customers?). The rest of the evening the waiter seemed frustrated by our rolling drink/food orders, the fact that we had multiple tabs going (which started at the bar), and was very unhappy about having to revise many of the bills as the food/drinks were not tracked to tabs correctly. We felt like we had to apologize for being an inconvenience. I would go back and sit at the bar for sure, but will skip table service in the future. I know firsthand that being a waiter/waitress is a very challenging job, but that's not an excuse to treat good customers poorly.
author: Amy M.

description: CASINO ROYALE...ended up being my favorite drink when it was the last drink I ever thought I would have ordered. The decor and service are superb. I had the pleasure of having Heather make my drinks, yes I had to stay for a few because they are that different and refined. Heathers service was a delight: humorous, sassy, Korean sexy mixologist. I really enjoyed my time at the European and already looking forward to and planning on returning with friends. If you like Trick Dog, Third Rail, Cotogna, you will enjoy the old fashioned-laborious preparations and memorable tastes of this bar.  See you soon Heather!
author: TVAT T.

description:
Wonderful bar! The decor is very stylish, the staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable. Awesome bar food and cocktails. I've enjoyed everything we've ordered: Aperol Kick, The European, Cocktail de Triomphe, shaved pork jowel/ricotta on smoked plancha bread, housemade spam on Texas toast and grape jelly. But the winners for me are:

- The brisket burger with fries and soft googie; and
- The Love Letter: vodka, lemon, hibiscus, ginger.

I'll be back for the Love Letter Burger Googie soon !! :)
author: Loubna M.

description: Such a lovely, elegant bar. We enjoyed our refreshing and delicious summer cocktails!
author: Christina R.

description: Bar with a cool, relaxed vibe. But I got super bad food poisoning from this place, for that reason alone I give it a one star. Maybe stick with only drinks if you visit The European.
author: R H.

description: The staff here are just fantastic and the drinks are excellent.  Make sure you order one of the specialty cocktails before dinner.  They are so good, you'll end up having three and then thinking, 'I'll just keep sitting here at the bar and order a burger.'  And then that burger ends up being one of the best you've ever had (not just because of the drinks) and all of a sudden you've never left your hotel in this city with amazing restaurants and it doesn't bother you a bit.
author: Warner M.

description: Love this place.  Food was outstanding...very creative.  Drinks were solid.  Highly recommend The European!
author: Mike C.

description: My wife and I went here on 7/3/15.  We saw the good Yelp reviews so we decided to give this place a try.  When we arrived, every seat was taken up.  This is usually a good sign.  However, when we finally found two open seats, we waited and waited for someone to take our order.  The bartender closest to us did not give us the time of day until someone standing behind us tried ordering a drink.  After this bartender gave us menus to look over a different bartender came over to take our order.  I ordered an old fashioned and my wife ordered a gin mojito.  While the bartender started to make our drinks, I overheard him ask his co-workers how to make an old fashioned.  Additionally he told multiple customers he did not know how to make drinks because it was his first week.  This is understandable.  Every person starts a new job.  However I feel if you don't know how to make a simple drink like an old fashioned you probably should be working at a cocktail bar.  My drink was ok.  My wife's drink was ok.  Hopefully this was just an off day.
author: Mac S.
